concept_data.title: Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa

summary: The "Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa" (COMESA) is a regional economic organization that aims to promote economic integration and cooperation among its member states. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, COMESA serves as a significant partner for trade and development initiatives. The EU engages with COMESA to enhance trade relations, support regional stability, and foster sustainable development. Legal instruments and agreements between the EU and COMESA facilitate the harmonization of trade policies, investment regulations, and customs procedures, thereby contributing to the broader objectives of regional integration and economic growth in Eastern and Southern Africa.
